useful_title: The Science of Language An Introduction
best_gem_comment: This class was interesting and I feel better off for having taken it, but I have my reservations. Prof. Sag–Parvardeh was really great and kind, and the entire teaching staff was really supportive. The psets were easy, short, and infrequent (too easy in my opinion) and this class was definitely a gem. This class achieved its goal in covering a broad range of introductory linguistics topics. However, this course definitely had its problems. The pacing of this class seemed really off. Lectures were attendance mandatory but they crawled by so slowly. The content that we covered in 2–3 classes (2.5–3 hrs) was covered just as easily in a 1–hr section. In fact, section felt like the most important part of the class. Additionally, there were often questions that arose during section or from psets that garnered confusion among the majority of students and never actually had a clear answer.
